story:

campaignTitle: Help me to become an Animation Artist
story:
I studied at the Instituto de Diseño de Caracas, Venezuela and I got
  graduated from Illustration. My dream has always been to work in
  animation. In order to achieve it, I would like to enroll in a Visual
  Development degree in San Francisco or Los Angeles I want to study visual development because I could improve my skills
  and create new ones to show my talents and pursue my dreams Unfortunately, my country is facing a strong political and economic
  crisis. It has been impossible for me and my family to pay a course abroad. This Fund would be oriented to pay a degree in visual development, in
  San Francisco, this includes classes like Perspective for Characters
  & Environment, Story Development, Cityscape Painting, among others. Anything you send to support this work is greatly appreciated. To learn more about my work please visit my Instagram account @aduahc
  or click here https://www.behance.net/Aduahernandez Enjoy! Thank you so much for helping me to make my dreams come true :) If you would like to learn more about the career program click here https://www.academyart.edu/academics/visual-development/graduate#

campaignTitle: Help finish queer Harlem Renaissance music short
story:
Shoga Films has been making documentaries about the intresection of race and sexuality for over a
  decade with multiple film festival screening and garnering some awards
  along the way. We are now attempting our most ambitious project yet,
  an historical retrieval of the under-appreciated participation of gays
  and lesbians in the Harlem Renaissance. Unlike our previous films,
  this will require a major budget of well over $200,000. HOWEVER, we
  are starting  with a smaller piece, "Congo Cabaret," that
  will prime the pump for further donations, grant applications, and the
  building of our community and audience. We recently completed a successful Kickstarter campaign to
  (inadequately) cover the costs of production of a short music film
  based on an adaptation of a Harlem Renaissance novel authored by
  Claude McKay, a gay writer of the period. That has been beautifully
  filmed but, we still need funds for post-production: editing,
    sound mixing, color correction, publicity and distribution . “Congo Cabaret” is a short music film based on a slice of Harlem
    Renaissance life from gay writer Claude McKay’s then-bestselling
    novel, Home to Harlem . Adapted by Quincy Gossfield ( The DL Chronicles ) and
    Robert Philipson ( Body and Soul: An American Bridge ),
    "Congo Cabaret" beautifully contextualizes  a knock-out
    performance of a Bessie Smith song by rising star Parisa Fitz-Henley
    (NBC's Midnight, Texas ). Featuring veteran actors Kevin
    Daniels ( Modern Family ) and Darryl Stephens ( Noah's
    Arc ), "Congo Cabaret" combined lush cinematography
    with finely nuanced acting. You will be amazed at how much this
    (projected) 15-minute short packs into its lean profile. This
    gorgeous footage, the creation of directors Deondray and Quincy
    Gossfield, must come to fruition. Please help us get there! If you can't donate yourself, share this link with those for
    whom the recuperation of Black queer history is important, as well
    as for those who want to support fine independent filmmaking. Shoga Films is a 501(3)c non-profit organizations. All
    donations are tax deductible! Watch our uber talented directors Deondray and Quincy Gossfield talk
  about his joy in bringing out the queer side of the Harlem Renaissance
  through their artistry. And who is this mystery man? Help us raise $ to finish
  post-production, so you can see....

campaignTitle: Help to pay for bleedingcritic.com's hosting fees
FILMS FOR FIVE HUNDRED!
story:
BE A LIGHT IN
    THE DARK PLAY 4 CALAIS brings pop-up cinema and play-time to the 600+
    children and 6000+ adults living in The Jungle in Calais. With
    little to do and tensions high, refugees are desperate for respite
    care and community building activities to take part in. A few brief hours of cinema screenings and play-time helps
    people take their minds off the pain and trauma they've already
    experienced and often continue experiencing. Every trip we make,
    myself and the volunteers are always met with open arms and great
    smiles and asked to return again as soon as possible... Which costs
    money. So, funds permitting, we head to Calais as often as we can;
    as such, our fundraising efforts are ongoing. PLAY 4 CALAIS is hosted by the Women and Children's Centre and
      The Baloo's Boys Youth Centre. We are generously supported by The Lexi Cinema in
      London https://thelexicinema.co.uk and
      roaming pop-up cinema The Nomad http://www.whereisthenomad.com with
      technical equipment. Find us on: Facebook Twitter Instagram

campaignTitle: 3D Printing Inspiration Class Visit to Art Museum
story:
My name is Elena Chiovaro, and I am an art teacher at Aloha High
    School. During the spring semester, my advanced drawing students
    will be starting a unit on 3D printing. They will be designing
    original characters and creating 3-dimensional models of these
    characters to be printed. LAIKA Animation Studios are pioneers of 3D printing technology.
     It is the base used in the skeletons for their stop-motion
    animation puppets. Currently, the Portland Art Museum has an
    exhibition of LAIKA's 3D printed puppets and other crafted materials
    used in their films. Not only is it an exceptional example of how 3D
    printing can be used as an art form, but L AIKA studios are
    based in Hillsboro, giving our students exposure to incredible
    art and technology being used locally. We would like to take the students to the LAIKA exhibit to
    inspire their work in 3D printing and character design. This exhibit
    is a once in a lifetime opportunity for Aloha students to see
    LAIKA's craftsmanship up close. The funds raised would pay for the cost of bus transportation
    for 40 students.

campaignTitle: WE GOTTA GET HIM A GPU!!!
Third Grade Stop Motion Animation Extravaganza
story:
My name is Damiana King and I teach third grade at Ridgewood
  Elementary School. My 23 students love using the iPads to show their
  learning. Students will be making stop motion animation to show their
  understanding of life cycles. But that is just the beginning, with
  these items in our classroom it opens up the possibility of many more projects! I am asking for the following: 5 iPad stands $95 ($19 each ) 4 microphones $96 (2 lavalier
  microphones $22 each and 2 table top microphones $26 each) 3 mini recording studios $150 ($50 each) Please help our class create stop motion! Thank you!

campaignTitle: 22: A Film About Veterans
story:
Who We are Rescue Doc Films is a 501(c)(3) not-for-profit media company committed to producing educational, challenging and socially
    relevant media to strengthen human and animal rights. The Cause In April of 2016, Rescue Docs was honored to document the Shepherd’s
  Men run from Boston to Atlanta. They each ran 22km per day wearing 22
  pounds for 9 days. The number 22 signifies the number of veterans that
  commit suicide every day. It’s a staggering number and one that we
  must bring to zero. We made a short film that chronicled the incredible efforts being
  made by the Shepherd's Men to raise money and awareness for the life
  saving work being done by the SHARE Military Initiative. As soon as we
  met the Shepherd's Men, we knew there was a much larger film that
  needed to be made. That film is 22. SHARE Military Initiative at Shepherd Center is a comprehensive
  rehabilitation program that focuses on assessment and treatment for
  service men and women who have sustained a mild to moderate traumatic
  brain injury and PTSD from the Afghanistan and Iraqi conflicts. 22 will tell the stories of these service men and women who
  volunteered to serve their country as they struggle to regain a normal
  civilian life. It is our hope that this film will let veterans
  struggling with PTSD and traumatic brain injuries know that they are
  not alone and it's OK to ask for help. Making The Film Making this film will require funds for equipment, crew, travel,
  editing, music, graphic design, marketing, festival submission fees,
  and much more. We have a proven track record of making films under
  budget and putting them to work for the causes that need them. How You Can Help We need your help to raise the funds necessary to make this film.
  With perks starting at $10 for a digital download of the film once
  it's completed to $1000 to become an Associate Producer of the film,
  there are ways that anyone can help. We also depend on you to share
  the campaign with your friends and family on social media. Thank You! Filmmaking is a collaborative art form, from camera operators to
  donors, every role on the team is imperative. Without your help, we
  simply would not be able to make this vitally important film. Thank you in advance for your consideration, Michael Samstag & Josh Gildrie Rescue Doc Films

campaignTitle: Joshua's studio equipment
story:
My name is Joshua Bradley, I am 15 years old. I’m currently a
    sophomore in high school. I am looking for funding to start creating
    some films. I first gained interest in video making after taking a
    video editing class my freshman year of high school. I currently am
    in need of: two to three cameras, a tripod for each, a backdrop
    stand, lights, and several microphones. With this I will be able to
    make quality videos with the techniques that I have learned. I’m
    extremely excited to get started! Some kids could receive these items in a series of Christmas and
    or birthday presents, but when you grow up in a family with 10
    children like me anything that you get is either a hand-me-down that
    has gone through a couple of your siblings, or it comes from a
    thrift store (mainly from the Goodwill). I work hard when I’m not at school, but it’s not to earn money.
    Every day after school I am either babysitting my younger siblings
    or my 2 and 3 year old nieces, taking care of my family’s 126
    rabbits (recently went up to 134 with the birth of the birth of two
    more litters), 14 pigs, 4 chickens, 9 dogs, and a cat (I only
    approve of the cat), or in the summer working landscaping jobs with
    my dad. The work I do with my dad helps pay for my clothes from
    Goodwill. I'm sorry i got a little off topic, but this fundraiser will be
    able to help me pursue a future in filmmaking, who knows maybe i'll
    make one of the next major films after i go to college and get
    degrees in Film, Animation, Audio, & Entertainment Business.
    Before I can do this I will need to learn as much as I can on my own. Thank you for your contribution, time, and consideration. I look
    forward to sharing the masterpieces I will be able to create with
    your help.

campaignTitle: I WONT GIVE UP- Pls Help me to achieve my dream!
story:
Hii, im Kei. I am 15 years old and currently fighting for the last
  year in high school. I've 1 younger brother and 1 younger sister. I
  will graduate next year and i wanted to go to the finest colleges and
  studying in Visual Communication Design. Of course, i'll study hard to
  enter the university, but the problem is i really dont want to burden
  my parents for the fees. First of all, my english is bad, but i hope you could understand.. Reason: I found out that i'll need a laptop,
  drawing tablet, art equipments, and other fees for college that i
  can't afford. My laptop died, i've used it since 2012. And, i only
  have that. I used my own money that i've collected to buy a phone for
  myself. Now i cant do that again bcs i only have the money transport
  to go to school. My parents still have to pay off our house.
  They still have to pay for my school fee, course fee, and others. But
  i only live once, i cant just give up like that. i wanted to try my
  best bcs maybe t here are lots of other people out there who may
    want to be myself. I've to be grateful for my life by trying my best. I'll busy studying and practicing for school.. I can't focus on
    any part time job. I can't find it too, they said im too young. Y es, i entered school too fast. Oh, and i a little bit in a rush cs i really have to learn and
    practice with the laptop and drawing tablet before August. School
    will have so many exams, tests, homeworks, so i dont have much time.. Last, Thank you so much for all your supports, any amount helps. All donations greatly appreciated, and thanks for helping me to
    achieve my dream ! and also i just want to say that if you have a
    dream, dont give up! You'll never know before you try and dont quit
    trying too! Life is important, enjoy and be happy. Hope i could get a job in an Animation company!!

campaignTitle: Faith and Family Films Projector/Sound Equipment
story:
Faith and Family Films started in 2007 in a small church in New
  Hampshire and has sense expanded to more churches and halls in
  Vermont. As we seek to expand our reach we need your help. Hollywood
  is not interested in bringing good family and faith based
  entertainment to the nation, we look to fix that problem, at least in
  the New England area by offering films that may otherwise never get
  seen in this area. There are many small churches that cannot show films due to not
  having the proper equipment to do so. Our goal is to have our own
  equiptment to travel with so we can bring films like "God's Not
  Dead", "Polycarp", "Herbie", "Welcome to
  Inspiration", "Heaven Is For Real", "Hoovey"
  and other great films to those who may not have the opportunity to see
  them otherwise. All of these films have been shown in the past and our
  future plans are to offer films like "Do You Believe?",
  "The Faith of Our Fathers", "War Room" and many
  other lesser known but just as good films to audiences aound the New
  England area, with a focus on Vermont and New Hampshire. We have had one organization in Vermont that recently cursed us
  during shows and purposly blocked the entrace so patrons could not
  attend or felt intimidated if they pushed by. this has not stopped our
  showings and is making our company stronger in its resolve to bring
  these films to the public. God has a bigger plan for this ministry and
  we already have had other churches step in to fill the void and we
  will continue to seek out more. Naturally we need to pay the royalties on each film, and in most
  cases we ask for a love offering which helps us cover expenses, and
  that's about all we do, cover our expenses. This is why we need your help. In 2015 we will have at least 37 showings of different films in
  different locations around NH and VT and we hope to add more! VT is
  currently considered the least religious, or most secular, state in
  the union. Please consider helping us with this great task at hand to spread
  Gods Word through film to more and more people. We currently do not
  charge any admission for our screenings, however we do ask for a love
  offering to help cover expenses, which they do in most cases. this is
  why we need your help to expand and spread Gods Word. The
  possibilities are unlimited with your help. A special thank you to Jesse at RacMan Christain Radio for producing
  our video!

campaignTitle: WTH Short Films
story: If you already here, that means you like us. We would like to use our movies for a good cause too. Hopefully, we are entertaining you,in addition we want to give a meaning to what we do for fun and hope WTH can put that to a good cause. Support us!

story: We are fundraising money for our movie "Lost Boy: The Bobby Driscoll Story". Bobby was the voice behind Peter Pan and his story is interesting and deserves to be told. We need help raising money for the cost of equipment and travel expenses.

campaignTitle: The Return of Dark Knight Films
story:

story:
$150 is the amount needed to pay domain and hosting fees for an

campaignTitle: Kate's Film Startup Campaign
story:
Please help support my new film project and digital space, that will

campaignTitle: Junk Food & Horror Films
story:
Junk Food and Horror Films is a short film about the triumph of an
  underdog with an overactive imagination. The main character, Jared, is just trying to go out and get some
  snacks and return in time to enjoy a horror film marathon, when he
  experiences a horror-like adventure of his own. This film touches on many themes: parent-child conflict, romance,
  horror, paranoia, and more. The audience will find themselves
  enthralled by this short film, rooting for Jared as he struggles
  through the past, present, and future... Hello, I'm Zak and I need just a little bit of funds for my upcomng
  thesis project. Even though my actors are working for free, I would at
  least like to feed them and pay for travel expenses and their is some
  equipment I would like to get for the project. I already have a good camera and most of the lighting equipment I need. I need props, food and paying for travel and also to rent some more
  equipment I do not have. This would really help out.

campaignTitle: Jeep Klips Adventure Films
story:
As some of you may know by now, I make films of almost every trip we
  do with our Jeeps. My YouTube channel 'JeepKlips' has over 14900 views
  and almost 100 subscribers. My films showcasing what we do as Jeepers
  have have been seen by people all across the world and I have actually
  spoken to people who joined this page because of my films. In order to
  keep moving forward with the channel and increase the quality of my
  films I ask that you give whatever you can to help me produce even
  better films than I do now. I will use your kind donations to purchase
  some HD filming equipment as well as a decent mic to add commentary to
  my films which will give them some much needed context as to what is
  going on.

campaignTitle: Oriole Park Pre-Production Fund
story:
Things are getting exciting for ORIOLE PARK as we
  continue our march toward production in the spring of 2015! Recently,
  we were named indieWIRE's Project of the Day and then won a hard fought battle for Project of the Week . We've also
  been one of the top trending films on Slated.com for several months! For those who don't know, Joey King ( Wish I Was Here, FX’s Fargo ) is attached to star and Joel Murray ( Mad Men, God Bless
  America ), and Christian Stolte ( Public
    Enemies, Chicago Fire ) will all play supporting roles. Our director is Kevin Slack , an accomplished music video
  director whose work includes The Gaslight Anthem’s “ Here Comes My Man ” and “ Handwritten ,” both of which have more than 1
  million views each online, and our composer is The Gaslight Anthem 's lead singer/songwriter
  Brian Fallon himself! We've also signed a sales agency agreement with Shoreline Entertainment , which means that after
  the film is made, they'll help us get it into theaters, on DVD, and
  VOD around the globe. As mentioned above, the film on Slated.com where you can see more
  details and watch the director's pitch video: ORIOLE PARK . We are in active pre-production (casting actors, working with our
  director, putting the production team in place) while we raise the
  money we need to fund the film, because we intend to begin shooting as
  early as May 2015. Because of the generous contributions we've received so far, we've
  been able to set up the Oriole Park LLC, hire a lawyer, draft
  contracts, and fly in Kevin to conduct location scouts and hold a
  table read with actors. The next phase of our journey involves
  drafting all of the legal documents we need, hiring the casting
  agency, a trip to LA to meet with actors and investors, and bringing
  Kevin back to Chicago for further pre-production and location scouting. We are reaching out to you today to ask for a contribution to help
  seed the next phase of the production. All contributions will assist
  with the film's operating expenses and will count towards the final
  budget. Of course, you are under no obligation to make a contribution. If you aren't in a position to make a contribution, all prayers, well
  wishes, and positive vibes are also welcome. Thanks for all your love and support, Amelia & Eric Corn
    Bred Films

campaignTitle: Megabat
story:
Hello!! The TCU Student Filmmakers' Association is back with
    three new films this semester. Megabat , our first in line
    of production, is a mockumentary following the lives of officers
    Charlie Gordon and Bert Fox. Any donations will be greatly appreciated!

campaignTitle: Tanika Travel disabelt on bed around the world
story:
My dream. Travel the world lying on bed My name is Tanika de Koning (26 years) My dream is traveling around the world, even though I am handicapped
  on bed. I believe in making the impossible possible. I have a rare
  muscular disease, and have been locked up in my room for years. But I
  am a fighter and I am crazy for my dreams, my passions and my talents.
  I'm in love with India. India is my dream country where I really want
  to go. From my childhood I dreamed of it. It makes my heart beat
  faster, the music makes me happy, the Bollywood movies inspire me. The
  love for India is almost impossible to explain. My spirit, my heart is
  there. I believe India will change my life. It's my destiny. Unfortunately, I can not buy a ticket like other people, sit and
  travel, and just walk in a car or train. Financially, I do not manage
  to do this. I am trying to find it very hard with savings and things,
  but after speaking to the organization, I have to pay eight times the
  airline ticket. I also need at least one supervisor, actually two.
  People taking care of me, lifting, helping etc. Because I have to pay
  separately for a stretcher, and because I have to pay for the chairs
  with the stretcher. And I can not raise that money ... In addition, a special van has to be made in India where I can lay on
  a bed (a high bed in which I can drive around and sleep). Also,
  overnight stays must be arranged for a special bed. These are all
  challenges, and also the financial costs involved. India is obviously
  not the country like in the Bollywood films. India is so big and so
  diverse. I want to travel there, but not alone. Bollywood industry In spite of the fact that I am in bed, I want to visit the
  bollywood the industry, writing scripts, acting, modelling in a
  variety of areas, and especially not my fashion. I am a high fashion
  designer and artist. It seems great to me to make beautiful outfits
  for the movie industry, but also to work with local people, and to
  start something. Thus, I can share my talents with my dream country. I
  also design on paper, because if people ask about it, lying on my side
  with pillows below, but unfortunately I can not sew it. Therefor I
  need other great people to work together, and make the creations alive. The movie industry has shown interest in me through social media. I
  have to say that on my photos you often do not see me being sick. But
  even then people are interested, but they all ask when you come here.
  This hurts my heart because they do not know how much I like to go to
  India. That sense of desire for your dream country, to your
  destination, but it also gives me an additional incentive to combine
  everything. I also hope with my art, with my talents, toever do it all
  by myself, and to regain my freedom with this. I also hope to be able to follow courses. For example, you will soon
  be in the movie industry, and you could learn a lot. In addition, I
  saw that courses from New York are given this year, wow “Sudha Chandran is a exemple of a disabled and actress” Traveling through India Of course next to the Bollywood industry, I want to travel through
  India and experience the life there, the feeling, the atmosphere, the
  colors, the scents, the people, the adventures, so you feel you're
  alive, one with everything. You can visit so many places in India. For
  me, this would be an additional challenge, as many old buildings, busy
  traffic, and there must be good roads and private hospitals. But most
  of all, I would see a lot, but, of course, the magic Taj Mahal.
  Besides, there are so many beautiful magic spots. Also I have contact
  with an organization that is just fine for Bollywood industry, so I
  have to go to Mumbai. I would also like to see nature, but I do not
  know if this is possible. I am grateful for everything I can see and
  experience. I hope, of course, to visit some festivals, Diwali or Holi
  or another, in terms of health, it should be possible, but I'm someone
  who gives everything. Divya II have one more reason. To meet Divya, my financial adoptive
  girl. I have a financial adoptive girl in southern India since I was
  19. Her name is Divya, and I love her, even though we never met. I'm a
  kind of mother, but more a girlfriend, helper, I have many caps on, we
  care a lot and I want the very best for her. And super good news:
  Through my help all those years, she goes to college to do a degree.
  She is the first of the organization to do this and I am very proud of
  her, so very proud. She worked so hard and I believe in her and will
  always believe in her. We have a wish together, and that is to really
  meet each other. All those years I wrote her that I worked on it, and
  I do, but unfortunately I did not succeed yet, but I keep on fighting.
  Because I wish with all my heart and soul that we meet each other. And
  I could finally give her all my love and support. The organization
  advised me to let her fly to me re that said to live far away, this
  can not be funded. So this is the case, but I want this so so when I
  finally go to India, I will definitely do that and open my arms and
  finally we can hug each other. Health treatment And not at least my health. If I finally go to my dream country, I
  want to stay longer. I know they have many things in India for health.
  I also have a Neuroborriolosis, in India, shows here what has to be
  done. Ayurveda treatments are also recommended to me. The doctors in
  the Netherlands gave me up and can not help me anymore, not even minor
  infections of anything. Therefore, I have to look elsewhere, so I want
  to grab chances with both hands. And try to at least get relief,
  especially for the intense pain, that would be something. That would
  be a great miracle! My father and I My father and I have a special band. Besides being there for me 24/7,
  picking me up, turning, eating, drinking, etc., our dream has always
  been to go to India. He also wanted to go to India in his youth, but
  life was hectic and he did not succeed. Then I was born and thus his
  love for travel, and especially to Indian areas, became extra strong,
  as if the other half of my soul lives there sometimes. My father told
  me about his dream .... he has not been able to travel for years and
  cares for me. I am so grateful to him, and it is not very good with
  him in terms of private circumstances. As long as my dad can lift and
  take care of me, we want to make this trip, because I do not know any
  other people who can, and he can not afford to do it. He grows older,
  I'm not getting in better health. My illness is progressively worse
  every year. If we still want to do this, and I want to give him this,
  and if he can go to a historic building, but I do not know that
  there's a super sweet person with me. I probably need somebody to
  really wash me, but find and arrange for me to help me so that my
  father can see and see it. So that he lives, I give him that too, it's
  also his childhood dream. Fashion and more My dream, health, passions and talents, experiences, love. My
  destination, as you can read. I want to try a lot and get it all out.
  I also have many fans in India for my work, my artwork, my fashion and
  more. I would like to try and arrange for them a greeting and
  greeting. I also hope to arrange a fashion show. I know someone who
  organizes events, so who knows if I can combine it? I hope so, so that
  local people can start a business for my foundation to help me, myself
  and others, to make something awesome with that talent. Psssst,
  secretly I want to live there hihi, even though I've never been there
  and I can't endure heat, and it's very hot there ... I hope to find a
  way I can make a bed with a kind of cooling system, so that I can keep
  it cool. I finally hope to come to my beloved India, despite pain and
  disability. I try to leave all my bad things behind me and make a new
  start in my beloved country. I know it would be intense, and I would
  have to rest a lot, but it's the country of yoga and gurus. My sweet dogs I have three shih tzu's and they are my everything, my angels on
  earth, and can not live without them. If I would make a short trip,
  then they should be kept in a nice spot, but I'm going to my
  destination, my core dreamland. So I want to go there too. The dogs
  must come there if this is possible. There are so many reasons I want
  to go there and there are so many possibilities there, but I have to
  get there first. This costs a lot of adjustments, wins, knocks,
  fighting and risks also take health because I've also attacks, and
  then I'm completely dependent of others, but there are also costs,
  things have to be created and, as I said, flying is already at least
  eight times the price, plus the stretcher plus, I have to pay at least
  one companion, the van, adjusted bed, places of stay, guides, health
  treatments also cost a lot of money. But I'm so grateful for
  everything that's going to happen. My thanks would be forever for you,
  and who knows, I can think of something that, if I can, for the people
  who want to take you with me a bit, when I talk on social media. Much
  love, Tanika. I suffer a lot, more then I tell or show, my looks are
  just looking normal, but I lay down on bed, because my bed is my
  wheelchair... that is a diffrent story. But I keep strong and will
  always fight for myself and others. Go follow your dreams! you can also donate on the foundation (stichtingtanika) with
  titel project India Om Stichting Tanika te ondersteunen kunt u geld overmaken
  op girorekening: 5593955 t.n.v. Stichting Tanika te Amsterdam IBAN: NL30INGB0005593955 BIC: INGBNL2A K.v.K. nummer: 34394153

campaignTitle: Death In A Dumpster: Making Of A Musical
story:
Death In A Dumpster: Making Of A Musical is a
  documentary about the struggles and triumph of 9 street youth. Some
  homeless. Some fighting personal challenges, but all fighting against
  the societal stigma and perception that comes with being street-involved. Filmed behind the scenes over the course of 7 months. Death In A
  Dumpster: Making Of A Musical is almost complete, but WE NEED YOUR
  HELP to help us finish the final product. All proceeds from this campaign will pay for editing and sound
  production of all 5 episodes leading up to and including the final performance. Please contribute. This film is more than just a documentary. It is
  about what is achievable and #nooneisdisposable

campaignTitle: JOEYWOOD FILMS
story: I'm a totally deaf.  I'm a director / producer of JOEYWOOD FILMS here in Upstate, South Carolina.  I start a fundraiser to support JOEYWOOD for making films with actors and actresses.  And we need equipments.  Thanks! Director of JOEYWOOD, Joey Johnson

campaignTitle: Help Pro Club build robotic inventions
story:
Aloha-Huber Park Elementary Middle School students have access
    to excellent reading, writing and math instruction, but we know that
    they need opportunities to learn and excel in 21st century skills
    such as design, engineering, and programming in order to make it in
    today’s marketplace. We currently have 20 5th-8th graders who are committing
    themselves to an After School Club called Pro Club where students will work collaboratively to produce films, build
    robots, program video games, make music and more.  These robots will
    give our students a reliable resource to make prototypes to make
    their creative vision a reality.  They will also serve as resources
    for our entire student body for the years to come, as we seek to
    continue to integrate STEM Engineering and Programming topics into
    our curriculum. Aloha-Huber Park K-8 serves a community with a high percentage
    of poverty.  The easy access to enrichment programs found in other
    local neighborhoods is not readily found at Aloha-Huber yet.  Please
    help an energetic staff and student body change this by funding the
    purchase of these robotic kits.  This equipment will help us to
    inspire students to take their learning, creativity, and design
    skills to the next level. The money will be used to purchase: 2 Lego Mindstorms Education EV3 Core set = $779.90 1 Parrot Mambo Code = $150

campaignTitle: STAR CINEMA
story:
Hello, My name is Christiyan  Hristov Ivanov. I'm from Bulgaria and I have
  recently moved to the country of the unlimited opportunities - The
  United Stated of America. I'm came here to fulfill my American dream. I have always dreamed of
  having my own movie theater. I have been working as cinematographer in
  a cinema and I've seen a lot of things that I could do better, smarter
  and more efficiently. Here is a description of my business idea. A movie theater, which is also called a cinema is a venue, usually a
  building that contains an auditorium for viewing films/movies or
  motion pictures as it is called in some quarters, for the purpose of
  entertainment or perhaps education. Almost all movie theaters are
  commercial operations open to the general public, who attend by
  purchasing a ticket. The Tickets It is not always easy to buy a movie ticket especially when the movie
  you want to watch is in the caliber of Star wars or Marvel movies. We
  will have an online system where you can buy your ticket. You will say
  “Ok that is not new every movie theater has that option”, but you will
  also have the option of choosing where to seat in the hall. Before
  getting to the stage of paying for your tickets you will see a map of
  the hall. From this map you choose the best seats available. And it is
  not only this. You will be able to make a reservation. For example –
  you want to watch a movie at 6pm but you are not sure you will be able
  to finish what you are doing before 6pm. You don’t need to buy your
  ticket and than loose the money because you were not able to come. You
  will be able to make a reservation, and again choose your seats. You
  do not need to pay. The only thing you need to do is show up 20
  minutes before the movie starts, show your reservation number, pay for
  the tickets and that is it. If you do not show up to get your tickets
  20 minutes before the movie starts, the system automatically will
  delete your reservation and you don’t lose money because you did not come. The movie theater it self The movie theater will have 5 fully equipped with the best projection
  machines. The 1st hall will be a VIP hall. The tickets will be a
  little bit more expensive compared to standard halls. You will be to
  lay dawn and watch your movie, even have you own table to put your
  popcorns, nachos or whatever you got to eat while watching. 2nd
  hall will be equipped with a 4DX system. This system allows to feel
  things, like different smells, water, wind, explosions. 3rd hall
  will be an IMAX hall. This is one of the best options if you are a big
  fan of 3D movies. 4th and 5th halls will be standard halls.

campaignTitle: Gotta SING - Never to late to live a DREAM
story:
Hi! Im Sue Rowe... Practially my whole life I have dreamed of being a
  singer even before I started acting. I took random voice lessons from
  a variety of coaches along my way. I studied with a coach from every
  genre of music including Rock, Gospel/Blues, Jazz, Broadway, Speech
  Level and a few others. It wasn’t until I hosted a live music show for
  8 months that I realized I loved Jazz/Blues the best and felt the most
  freedom when I sang in that style. So I made the move from a lifetime
  of hopes to be a country singer to singin the Blues... One of my biggest fears I had to overcome was my stage fright. When I
  started I did not even know how to use a mic. So I frequently went to
  karaoke bars to learn mic control and before you know it I was
  entering Karaoke competitions and started to place! I even took 14th
  at a national level competition with contestants from all over the
  globe! I was making progress and overcoming my fears at the same time. Now I know most singers get their start when they 20’s or even
  younger. But I was rasing babies and had a few other challenges... my
  story is an interesting one... prehaps for a different day or for a
  book later on. After all, I am still writing my story and you are
  helping me to write it...  I’m 44 now and I just wrote my first song!
  I won the battle to be ME and never gave up! I never thought it was
  possible to be where I am now. I want to show everyone out there, it
  is never to late to Live your Life. Now that my big battle is a war of
  my past life lived, I’m ready share my heart and soul through my
  music, music videos and even my feature films soon to come... I have found the right producer to make these songs into ones that
  will be lasting impressions. This first push will be for the first
  recording session. We have the band all fired up and ready to record.
  The recording session for the first three songs will be $7,500. The funding will go towards the following... Title: ”LOVE IN FOUR CORNERS” 1 Day Recording Drums, Hornes, Upright Base, Guitarist, Rhythm 2,500 Studio Time Mixing Mastering 2,000 Vocal Recording 1 Day Mixing Mastering w/track 1,000 Producer to oversee entire production 1,500 Promotions for Final EP Music only 500 If I am able to get over the ammount I need I will start putting it
  towards my Video Production budget for a professionally recoded music video. For all you that contribute we will be having a 1920’s themed Jam
  later on this summer to launch the EP and you will have the exclusive
  invitation and pre show invites! Can’t wait to see you all there! Thank you for being my friends and most of all for believing in my
  Dreams. I have the best group of friends on this planet that a gal
  could ask for ❤️

campaignTitle: HoldeNall Films 48 hr. project
story: HoldeNall Films is competing in several film contests this year and would like your support. They are pulling a talented group of people together to create entertaining works of art with a message. Any and All support is greatly appreciated.

campaignTitle: Support us to create Islamic Animation Videos
story:
Bismillahir Rahmanir Raheem Asslamu Alaikum Waramathullahi Wabarakathuhu Who are we and what are we? We are a group of passionate individuals together with scholars
    striving to bring this holy Deen into our lives and to the lives of
    the entire mankind through the digital media. The TOP ISLAMIC NETWORK consists of a heavily followed twitter handle and a super fast
    growing Facebook page, Instagram account and a YouTube Channel where
    we regularly update quotes, posters and animations. Visit our Dawah Network: Twitter: https://twitter.com/topislamicnet Facebook: http:// facebook.com/topislamicnet Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/maestrouzy/ YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/topislamicnet Alhamdulillah, as of today’s calculation (18/01/2017) our
    network reaches to more than 7 million people a month and around 300,000 of them engage themselves to
    our tweets, posts or videos. And the number grows higher and higher
    on a regular basis. What is this fundraiser for? To make this project successfully run till the last day, Insha
    Allah. We currently have a team of 06 fulltime workers and a few
    freelancers. Our costs includes the salaries of staff, purchase of
    montages, rent for the office space, utility bills, data connections
    and other overheads. Alhamdulillah, with the help of the Almighty we
    are currently bearing this huge cost until today. As the days pass,
    we find it difficult to reach the next level or to continue this
    massively rewarding project on our own, hence we need your financial assistance. What do I get in return? How many rewards are we talking about? Well, I would say billions. According to the nearest meaning a
    hadith, “Whoever calls to guidance receives its rewards and the
    rewards of those who followed him”. And we can assure you that all
    your money will be invested in a way that you get its full potential
    in this life and in the hereafter. Our goals for the year of 2017: Bigger and better team. Better equipment. Successfully provide posters and videos to our entire social media network. Make our contents more attractive and more professional. Build a website for TOP ISLAMIC NETWORK. Build a mobile application to easily get in touch with beneficial reminders. May Allah help us to attain his pleasure and to reach our goals
    in our lives. May Allah bless you with more and more goodness. Jazakallahu Khaira for your concern Yours sincerely, Uzman Muhajir. Founder and CEO – Top Islamic Network.

campaignTitle: Making an Independent movie about a BigFoot
story:
Hello, my name is Derek Taylor and I love independent films. I enjoy
  the improvisation and creativity that goes into making this type of
  film, and the people that work on a project such as this. DreamQuest Productions Australia is dedicated to this activity. Our
  goal is to make a feature length movie, using a 4K Red Camera which we
  already have. We have a talented team of artists and actors who are
  keen and willing to bring this story to life on screen. The financial support we seek will pay for production costs such as
  actors, make up artists, logistics, location hire, equipment hire,
  editing, marketing and promotion, insurance cover and DVD production. Please support our independent production, and you will be satisfied
  to know alternative artistic talent is striving to complete a film not
  made in the mainstream. We are serious about making this film and have put together some
  preliminary material - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1IMBzE1A2Yc

campaignTitle: Eat Your Heart Out: A Magical Realism Short Film
story:
And so begins our 30-day countdown to shoot Eat Your Heart Out ... well, it is with your help. Abby Pierce and Julia Lederer are collaborating once again as writers
  on this magical realism
    short film that Abby will direct. It is intended to tour the international film festival circuits and will serve as their pitch to production companies to produce the
    feature-length film . They have assembled an accomplished crew, and a cast you might
  recognize from shows like Community, This Is Us, Modern Family, Chicago Fire, Battlestar
  Galactica and movies like LA Confidential,
      Brokeback Mountain, and Pearl Harbor. An established film production company, 71 Degrees North , has partnered with the film
  and has agreed to give us $200,000 worth of equipment. The actors and producers are working for free, and the crew is
  working well below their standard rates, all because they believe in
  this story. What is our budget for? The crew is working below their standard rate, but we are shooting
  multiple days and need to compensate them for their expertise and
  work. We need to budget in insurance for our film equipment, and need
  to provide food for the cast and crew. Also, there are costumes,
  props, locations, and... well... blood (but in a charming way!). There's also editing, color correcting, sound mixing, and music rights. It adds up quickly. It's gonna happen! We are beginning our shoot July 7th. Everyone is
  signed up and ready to go. We have the kindest and most talented team
  and everyone is passionate about this movie. Be a part of the film! We'd love to see your name
      in the credits. Bios of the team Jason
  Chiu (Direcor of Photography) Jason is the visionary of the cinematography of this film. He has
  worked on commercials for Nissan, Samsung, McDonald’s , and The Special Olympics . He was the DP for the award-winning
  films Runner and Henry Gamble’s Birthday. Kyle Leland (1st Assistant Director) Kyle is an award-winning filmmaker in Chicago. He worked 10 years as
  a production assistant on major studio productions and produced local
  commercials since 2010. His short film for the 48 Hour Film Project
  won top honors at Filmapalooza 2018 and was selected to screen at the Cannes Film
  Festival this year. Abby Pierce (Co-Writer, Director, Actor) Abby is an improvisor, writer, director, and teacher in Chicago. The
  webseries she created and co-wrote, The Exquisite Corpse , partnered her with OpenTV . She also teaches theater to inmates at
  Cook County Jail along with Beacon Academy and various schools. She
  will be directing Hopelessly Devoted at Piven Theatre next
  March, which will also tour local prisons and jails. She is acting and
  partnering with Pulitzer Prize Winner David Auburn on his upcoming
  world premiere of The Adventures of Augie March next April.
  Abby has appeared in Chicago Fire , Chicago PD ,
  performed stand-up on TBS’s Rooftop Comedy Hour , and in
  various indie films. Julia Lederer (Co-Writer) Julia is an internationally-acclaimed, award-winning writer. Her
  plays have been produced across North America and in the UK. The
    Toronto Star called her “delightfully original” and Crain’s Chicago
    said her work is, “wonderfully weird, piercingly poetic and
    unexpectedly moving.” NOW Magazine wrote, “Keep your eye on Lederer,
    whose got huge potential.” Graham Beckel (narrator) Film and TV credits include: L.A. Confidential, Brokeback
      Mountain, Battlestar Galactica, The Paper Chase, Leaving Las Vegas Charley Koontz (Actor) Film and TV credits include: Community, CSI: Cyber, Modern
      Family, Rubber, and This Is Us. Christine Vrem-Ydstie (Producer) Katherine Bourne Taylor (Producer) Martin Rodhal (Executive Producer) Neha Schultz (Executive Producer) Braden Coucher (Production Designer) Joshua McClain (Location Scout) TBA: Sound Designer, Composer, Editor, Sound Mixer, Color Corrector,
  Props Designer, Costume Design, Lighting Design, Assistant Camera,
  Production Assistant

campaignTitle: Am traveling to screen films to other cities
story: I just learned about FundRazr. We are traveling with films to screen to other cities outside of our county in May, 2013: Santa Rosa, Cotati, Ukiah, Ojai, Santa Barbara, Ventura. 7 film screenings in 7 days. OCCUPY LOVE and KUMARE are the films AND to stimulate conversation after the film like a town-hall meeting..... Funds go to paying for films ($700), gas (nearly 1,000 miles @ 35mpg = $120), scheduling/promoting (70 hours), sleeping over (?), lowering the admission fee of screenings to allow people who can't afford it to see the films. Oh, did I say eating? hahhaha

campaignTitle: BANFF MEDIA FESTIVAL MEET WITH NETFLIX
story:
My name is Tammy Lynne and I am an Indigenous Filmmaker. I was
    just accepted to receive $1000 to attend BANFF WORLD MEDIA FESTIVAL
    through creative B.C. passports to markets fund. This is a great
    opportunity to kick-start many of my film projects in development,
    plus, find distribution opportunities for my completed documentary
    film project WHEN THEY TOOK THE CHILDREN. I need the money because
    my total costs to make this happen is $3690. I have $690 to chip in
    myself so the total I need is only $2000. Which consists of 1695
    conference registration, $600 airfare, $400 4 night hotel, 4 days
    food $240, ground transportation $200, marketing materials $200,
    overhead $335. I'll be finding ways to scale this back and make sure
    this happens. Any and all help is super appreciated. . thanks for
    your time!!! So many of my projects will be supported by this trip including
    my newest project BENEATH THE WEB (horror/thriller). Which I'll be
    working on with my daughter. This is a project that is fun and
    exciting. Which is different from all the emotional work I have been
    doing. I also have a great animation project called GREY EYES (kinda
    like a First Nations Harry Potter)created by my wonderful writer
    friend Frank Busch. I will also be looking for leads for my
    documentary series THEY NEVER STOPPED TAKING THE CHILDREN. Which
    takes a look at the international problem of wrongful First Nations
    child apprehension. A project very close to my heart. This
    opportunity will get me lunch with decision makers like  NETFLIX.
    I'll also send updates of the progress of my trip!! All donors of
    $30 or more get a copy of my latest completed documentary WHEN THEY
    TOOK THE CHILDREN. OR a piece of vintage sterling silver jewelry!!!
    Any and all help is appreciated!!! Thanks so much for your time!!!

campaignTitle: Kickstart my Animation Career - I need a Cintiq!!
story:
3 years ago at the tender age of 11 I found an animation website and
  taught myself how to animate. Art talent runs in my family. I have
  BugsBunny and Walt Disney in my veins. At the tender age of 13 I
  decided to make animation my career, I have been using a primitive 200
  dollar Bamboo tool so far, but come on guys, it's time to bump it up
  to the next level and move into more serious hardcore technology so I
  can put my stone-age tool to rest. Because my mom and I decided that
  we still would like to eat and wear clothes for the next few months,
  we thought it would be best to ask for help from people that have
  money for food, clothes, and a little extra for people like us, and
  since you're reading this I guess that means you. A professional
  Cintiq is only 3,000 dollars, but my mom would probably take 3 years
  to save 3,000 dollars. I need it now, not in 3 years, sorry mom. I
  would be forever grateful for every 1 dollar, 5 dollar, or 3,000
  dollar donation that comes in. I might even dedicate one of my
  characters to you and you will see yourself on the cartoon network
  between Bugs Bunny and Spongebob. Go ahead, make my day. Wouldn't you
  like to be an answer to prayer? Be God's little helper and become a
  cartoon character all at the same time. Help me while I'm still the
  tender age of 15. Renew my faith in humanity, help the poor suffering
  children of the world. God bless, and thank you. Amen.

campaignTitle: September FiLMs in Santa Barbara and Ojai
story:
Need extra cash to make the traveling smoother: for gas, purchasing
  film rights, spending oodles of time promoting in various ways,
  designing flyers and mailing them out, paying the venue... I screen
  these films because they are seeds of and for change; they reveal
  messages of possibility, they inspire, move people to tears and to
  action... and the newer ones are transformative in the sense they are
  more like movies with drama, with a moving sound track, with pauses
  that allow the viewer to really get engaged with the participants, the
  change agents, the activists and the issues. And we have a
  conversation afterwards, facilitated by myself with the additional
  folks who also are knowledgable about the specific issues... ~ bob banner
